metadata.title: CVE-2013-2219 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The Red Hat Directory Server before 8.2.11-13 and 389 Directory Server donot properly restrict access to entity attributes, which allows remoteauthenticated users to obtain sensitive information via a search query forthe attribute.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2219` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.3.2.11-0ubuntu1
389-ds-base - 1.3.2.11-0ubuntu1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.3.2.11-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.2.11-0ubuntu1').
